channel.title: CreepyPasta's
channel.description:
Most have heard of them. You can find them on it's wiki (Link below). I did some research on this one for Spongebob. The episode is called "Red Mist" [Links available on request]. While watching one of the many (this one supposedly the real one) of the remakes/etc of it. I found something that just f[b][/b]ucked with me. I freeze framed the video perfectly before a static, and the image I got shows two people (Girl and guy???) side by side. Possibly one in the middle of them. This makes me think the first video I watched about this was true. I don't know if CreepyPasta's are real or not, or just some made up bull on the internet. Or a mix of both. Here's the screenie I happen to get: [img]http://i.imgur.com/UEQiQRL.png[/img]
Yes, you can see my email, and a very very tiny image of me. I don't care.
Here's the topic to discuss: Are CreepyPasta's real, fake, or both? Evidence would be nice.
Creepy Pasta Wiki: [url=http://creepypasta.wikia.com/wiki/Creepypasta_Wiki]click here[/url]

item.title: CreepyPasta's
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

OK so ur wit ur honey rite. The fone rigns n u answer. u say hello??? n d voice say “y u wit my daughtr”. u hang up n tell ur girl it wuz her father. she says “my dad died”. THEN WHO WAS FONE???

Read full topic

item.title: CreepyPasta's
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Pokemon creepy pastas are always interesting, I always wished at least the stuff about lavender town was real but unfortunately it’s all been debunked. Pokemon has a lot of potential to be some really effed up shiznit, but sadly they stick to little kid games and movies.

Read full topic

r/nosleep is pretty good, some really well written stories as stated above.

@rip4d wrote:

You shouldn’t have done that.

Read full topic

item.title: CreepyPasta's
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I love creepypastas, but they fucked me up something good in 8th grade and I couldn’t sleep right for a long time, and probably failed a class for it. I usually just hang around /r/nosleep, and there’s some really well written stories there.

In my opinion, they’re as real as you want them to be. I think they’re just (sometimes) well written stories by clever authors (hell, Jadusable admitted Ben Drowned was fake, and there’s still people who swear by their life that he’s lying, or “possessed” by Ben).

Read full topic

item.title: CreepyPasta's
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Literally, once you’ve read one creepy-pasta you’ve pretty much read them all. Pokemon Black and the Zelda Majora’s Mask one are the most popular and pretty much every one following has a very similar story. They’re pretty entertaining if done well though. This guy does a very good job narrating them, and is quite funny too. I’d recommend checking him out.



Read full topic

item.title: CreepyPasta's
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:2, topic:515875”]For those who don’t know what this is:

[quote]
In short, a Creepypasta is a short story that is posted on the internet that is designed to unnerve and shock the reader. This wiki is primarily a database of various QUALITY Creepypasta. The goal is to have a fairly well stocked library of well-written Creepypasta, including very obscure and rarely posted, to user created original content.[/quote]

and

[quote]
Creepypasta are essentially internet horror stories, passed around on forums and other sites to disturb and frighten readers. The name “Creepypasta” comes from the word “copypasta”, an internet slang term for a block of text that gets copied and pasted over and over again from website to website. Creepypastas are sometimes supplemented with pictures, audio and/or video footage related to the story, typically with gory, distorted, or otherwise shocking content.[/quote]

I know what this is, and found out about it a long time ago (when I was like 13-14) and was freaked out by it but never went into depth with it. I don’t see what’s so “fictional” about it, people are putting pictures, videos etc. together to freak the audience, unless I’m not getting something here - it’s real.[/quote]
The story behind “red mist” is that some interns of Nickelodeon Studios walked into a room to view the video of this episode, and they found a really really demented version of it, none like a usual episode. Backlogs said it was edited 24 seconds before it was watched.

Read full topic

item.title: CreepyPasta's
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

For those who don’t know what this is:

In short, a Creepypasta is a short story that is posted on the internet that is designed to unnerve and shock the reader. This wiki is primarily a database of various QUALITY Creepypasta. The goal is to have a fairly well stocked library of well-written Creepypasta, including very obscure and rarely posted, to user created original content.

and

Creepypasta are essentially internet horror stories, passed around on forums and other sites to disturb and frighten readers. The name "Creepypasta" comes from the word "copypasta", an internet slang term for a block of text that gets copied and pasted over and over again from website to website. Creepypastas are sometimes supplemented with pictures, audio and/or video footage related to the story, typically with gory, distorted, or otherwise shocking content.

I know what this is, and found out about it a long time ago (when I was like 13-14) and was freaked out by it but never went into depth with it. I don’t see what’s so “fictional” about it, people are putting pictures, videos etc. together to freak the audience, unless I’m not getting something here - it’s real.

Read full topic
